Body.Description: Type definition for a Hypervisor Host.
Body.Label: ESXi Host
Body.Name: HypervisorHostType

TypeDefinition.Description: Size must be a number (used in conjunction with unit).
TypeDefinition.Label: Size
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeSize

TypeDefinition.Description: Unit is a string with a single character unit symbol. Valid unit symbols are K, M, G, T, and P representing Bytes, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, Terabyte, and Petabyte respectively, where one Kilobyte equals 1024 Bytes, one Megabyte equals 1048576 Bytes and so on.
TypeDefinition.Label: Unit
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeUnit

TypeDefinition.Description: If selected, export via NFS. Either create a new export policy by providing the client match string(s) or select an existing export policy.
TypeDefinition.Label: Export via NFS
TypeDefinition.Name: ExportViaNfs

TypeDefinition.Description: If selected, create a new export policy by providing the client match string(s) or unselect to use an existing export policy. The new export policy will be created using nfs for access policy and sys for read-only access rule, read-write access rule, and superuser security type.
TypeDefinition.Label: New Export Policy
TypeDefinition.Name: CreateExportPolicy

TypeDefinition.Description: The match string(s) specifying the client(s) to grant access to in an export policy rule.
TypeDefinition.Label: Client Match
TypeDefinition.Name: ClientMatchList

TypeDefinition.Description: The user or group that will be granted access.
TypeDefinition.Label: User or Group
TypeDefinition.Name: UserOrGroup

TypeDefinition.Description: The level of access granted to the user or group.
TypeDefinition.Label: CIFS Access
TypeDefinition.Name: CifsAccess

Body.Description: An IPv4 address represented in dot decimal notation, such as '192.168.1.6'.
Body.Label: IPv4 Address
Body.Name: IpV4AddressType

TypeDefinition.Description: An IPv4 address represented in dot decimal notation, such as '192.168.1.6'.
TypeDefinition.Label: IPv4 Address
TypeDefinition.Name: IpV4Address

Body.Description: Remove a NAS volume with storage virtual machine name and volume name as inputs. This will unmount the volume disrupting clients accessing the data, take the volume offline, and delete the associated data, Snapshot copies, and objects in the volume. On successful execution, the deleted volume name is generated as output.
Body.Label: Remove NetApp NAS Smart Volume
Body.Name: RemoveNetAppNasSmartVolume

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: Volume name.
InputDefinition.Label: Volume
InputDefinition.Name: VolumeName

Body.Description: Create a NAS volume with volume name, storage virtual machine name, volume size, performance service level, and export policy or access controls as the inputs. On successful execution, the volume name, volume capacity, and export policy id are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: New NetApp NAS Smart Volume
Body.Name: NewNetAppNasSmartVolume

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: Volume name can be between 1 and 197 characters long. The name should begin with a letter and only "a" to "z", "A" to "Z", "0" to "9", and underscore (_) are allowed.
InputDefinition.Label: Volume Name
InputDefinition.Name: VolumeName

InputDefinition.Description: If selected, create a FlexGroup volume.
InputDefinition.Label: Distribute volume data across cluster
InputDefinition.Name: FlexGroup

InputDefinition.Description: Volume size and unit.
InputDefinition.Label: Volume Capacity
InputDefinition.Name: VolumeCapacity

InputDefinition.Description: Performance service levels represent the performance expectations of the clients or applications using the storage system. The selection of a performance service level indicates the location of the new storage in the cluster and the QoS policy assigned to the storage. Value is used for applications for which throughput and capacity are more important than latency. Performance is used for applications with modest performance needs and latency. Extreme is used for applications that expect the lowest latency and highest performance.
InputDefinition.Label: Performance Service Level
InputDefinition.Name: PerformanceServiceLevel

InputDefinition.Description: NAS volume access permissions.
InputDefinition.Label: Access Permissions
InputDefinition.Name: AccessPermissions

InputDefinition.Description: If selected, enable local snapshot copies using the default policy.
InputDefinition.Label: Enable Local Snapshot Copies
InputDefinition.Name: LocalSnapshotCopies

TypeDefinition.Description: Canonical disk (also called NaaId) that backs the datastore (example: 6cc167e972c4928023401a54db995b66).
TypeDefinition.Label: Disk
TypeDefinition.Name: Disk

TypeDefinition.Description: The remote path of the NFS mount point.
TypeDefinition.Label: Remote Path
TypeDefinition.Name: RemotePath

TypeDefinition.Description: The hostnames or IP addresses of remote NFS server. In case of NFS v4.1 this may have multiple entries.
TypeDefinition.Label: NFS Server Address
TypeDefinition.Name: RemoteHostNames

TypeDefinition.Description: Access mode for the NFS server. Select read-only if volume is exported as read-only.
TypeDefinition.Label: Access Mode
TypeDefinition.Name: AccessMode

TypeDefinition.Description: Security for the NFS datastore. Default is the basic AUTH_SYS security.
TypeDefinition.Label: Security type
TypeDefinition.Name: SecurityType

Body.Description: Remove datastore from selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), datastore as inputs. On successful execution, the datastore name, NaaId of the deleted datastore, and the LUN number are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: Remove Hypervisor Datastore
Body.Name: RemoveHypervisorDatastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore is hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore is hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the datastore to be removed.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Name of the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore
OutputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Disk associated with the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: Disk name
OutputDefinition.Name: NAAId

OutputDefinition.Description: LUN number of the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: LUN Number
OutputDefinition.Name: LUNNumber

Body.Description: Create a new datastore on selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), and datastore. For VMFS, the canonical disk name, and VMFS version inputs are needed. For NFS, remote server and mount path, and NFS version are needed. On successful execution, the datastore name, disk name, VMFS version, and datacenter name are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: New Hypervisor Datastore
Body.Name: NewHypervisorDatastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name for the new datastore, limited to 42 characters.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description: Type and version of the new datastore. Minimum datastore size: VMFS 5 - 1.3GB, VMFS 6 - 2GB. Kerberos support is enabled in NFS4.1 only.
InputDefinition.Label: Type of Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: DatastoreVersion

OutputDefinition.Description: Name of the newly created datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore
OutputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
OutputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

OutputDefinition.Description: Type of the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: VMFS Version
OutputDefinition.Name: VMFSVersion

OutputDefinition.Description: Type of the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore Type
OutputDefinition.Name: DatastoreType

OutputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
OutputDefinition.Label: Cluster
OutputDefinition.Name: Cluster

OutputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
OutputDefinition.Label: Host
OutputDefinition.Name: Host

OutputDefinition.Description: Disk identity of the newly created datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Disk
OutputDefinition.Name: Disk

Body.Description: Create a NAS datastore. A volume with the same name as the datastore is created using the New NetApp NAS Smart Volume task.

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name for the new datastore, limited to 42 characters. It should begin with a letter and only "a" to "z", "A" to "Z", "0" to "9", underscore (_) are allowed. The volume created will be named the same as the datastore name.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore Name
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datastore/volume size and unit.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore Capacity
InputDefinition.Name: VolumeCapacity

InputDefinition.Description: Access mode for the NFS server. Select read-only if volume is exported as read-only.
InputDefinition.Label: Access Mode
InputDefinition.Name: AccessMode

InputDefinition.Description: Security for the NFS datastore. Kerberos support is enabled in NFS 4.1 only. Default is the basic AUTH_SYS security.
InputDefinition.Label: Security Type
InputDefinition.Name: SecurityType

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: If selected, create a FlexGroup volume.
InputDefinition.Label: Distribute volume data across cluster
InputDefinition.Name: FlexGroup

InputDefinition.Description: Performance service levels represent the performance expectations of the clients or applications using the storage system. The selection of a performance service level indicates the location of the new storage in the storage device and the QoS policy assigned to the storage. Value is used for applications for which throughput and capacity are more important than latency. Performance is used for applications with modest performance needs and latency. Extreme is used for applications that expect the lowest latency and highest performance. Note: If the selected performance service level is not valid for the storage platform, the task will fail with an error message. Use the None option if the storage virtual machine already has a QoS policy group.
InputDefinition.Label: Performance Service Level
InputDefinition.Name: PerformanceServiceLevel

InputDefinition.Description: If selected, create a new export policy by providing the client match or unselect to use an existing export policy.
InputDefinition.Label: New Export Policy
InputDefinition.Name: NewExportPolicy

InputDefinition.Description: Match string specifying the client or clients to grant access to in the export policy rule.
InputDefinition.Label: Client Match
InputDefinition.Name: ClientMatch

InputDefinition.Description: Select existing export policy.
InputDefinition.Label: Export Policy
InputDefinition.Name: ExistingExportPolicy

InputDefinition.Description: If selected, enable local snapshot copies using the default policy.
InputDefinition.Label: Enable Local Snapshot Copies
InputDefinition.Name: LocalSnapshotCopies

Body.Label: New NAS Datastore Using NetApp Smart Volume
Body.Name: NewNASDatastoreUsingNetAppSmartVolume

Tasks.Description: Create a NAS volume with volume name, storage virtual machine name, volume size, performance service level, and export policy or access controls as the inputs. On successful execution, the volume name, volume capacity, and export policy id are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: New NetApp NAS Smart Volume
Tasks.Name: NewNetAppNasSmartVolume

Tasks.Description: Create a new datastore on selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), and datastore. For VMFS, the canonical disk name, and VMFS version inputs are needed. For NFS, remote server and mount path, and NFS version are needed. On successful execution, the datastore name, disk name, VMFS version, and datacenter name are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: New NAS Datastore
Tasks.Name: NewHypervisorDatastore

Body.Description: Remove VMFS or NFS datastore from Vmware hypervisor.
Body.Name: RemoveHypervisorDatastoreImpl

Body.Description: Create a new VMFS/NFS Datastore on Vmware hypervisor.
Body.Name: NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImpl

Output.Datastore: {{if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS6"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS5"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS41"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS41.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS.output.Datastore}}{{end}}
Output.DatastoreType: {{if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS6"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS5"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS41"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS41.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{end}}
